comments:

It seems that some boundary cases has not been tested and protected.

Unable to reproduce using build F1.
Which build are you using?

Steps:
- start Eclipse
- create 3 projects with content
- close all projects
- exit Eclipse
- start Eclipse
- works OK

Do you have steps to reproduce this?

It would be interestin to know why the IOException occurred in the first 
place. Hmm...

To be fixed in FP1.

Fixed.  Now checking for null before trying to set the name.  Now the original 
IOException should surface correctly.
